Warm-up (2-3 min)

MEX review:

li re pi'i vo du li ? = ?

(Answer: 8)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
merko x1 reflects American (USA) culture American
brito x1 reflects British culture British

What Are Pro-bridi?

Pro-bridi are placeholder predicates that stand in for real selbri:

Pro-bridi Use
broda Placeholder 1
brode Placeholder 2
brodi Placeholder 3
brodo Placeholder 4
brodu Placeholder 5

Using Pro-bridi

When you want to refer back to a predicate without repeating it:

mi tavla bau la .jbobau. .i do broda

I speak in Lojban. You [do the same].

lo gerku cu bajra .i lo mlatu cu broda

The dog runs. The cat [does the same].

In Definitions

Pro-bridi are useful in definitions or general statements:

ro da poi broda cu brode

Everything that [does X] [does Y].

Multiple Pro-bridi

mi broda .i do brode .i la .alis. brodi

I [do X]. You [do Y]. Alice [does Z].

Key Point

Pro-bridi let you reference predicates without repeating them. Useful for comparison and definitions.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Use broda

Complete with broda:

  1. "I eat. You [do the same]." → mi citka .i do ___
  2. "The dog sleeps. The cat [does the same]." → lo gerku cu sipna .i lo mlatu cu ___
  3. "Alice walks. Bob [does the same]." → la .alis. cu cadzu .i la .bob. cu ___
Answers
  1. broda
  2. broda
  3. broda

Exercise 2: Culture Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is American.
  2. Bob is British.
  3. American and British are different.
Answers
  1. ti merko
  2. la .bob. cu brito
  3. lo merko cu frica lo brito

Exercise 3: Pro-bridi in Context

What does this mean?

mi nelci lo plise .i xu do broda
Answer

I like apples. Do you [like apples too]?

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Use pro-bridi aloud:

  1. "I work. Do you [work too]?" → mi gunka .i xu do broda
  2. "Alice studies. Bob does the same." → la .alis. cu tadni .i la .bob. cu broda

Summary

You learned pro-bridi (broda, brode, etc.) for referencing predicates without repetition.
